intro: Draba hirta f. tenuis, commonly known as the slender hairy rockcress, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and small, alternate leaves that are hairy and often glandular. The flowers are typically bright yellow, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, typical of the mustard family. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. This plant is well adapted to cold climates and is often used in rock gardens due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
